This weekly bulletin informs students, parents, and staff about internships, academic
programs, jobs, community service options, and leadership initiatives, along with
other student opportunities in a variety of fields. Please carefully note deadlines, age
requirements, and other pre-requisites for participation.
For ease of use, these newsletters are organized by different categories, such as
Academic Programs, Business Internships & Jobs, STEM Opportunities, Community
Service, and so on.
Questions, suggestions, and information about other opportunities are always
welcome and appreciated, and may be sent to Internship/Opportunity Coordinator
Harvey Blumm at: hblumm@stuy.edu - we will share your helpful information with
the Stuy community!
Please note that a good number of NEW programs are listed in today’s edition, please
check them out ASAP, as deadlines are rapidly approaching – several are highlighted
below:
EVENTS: All students are welcome to register for free dance classes at Stuy, offered
by outstanding instructors from the ‘Battery Dance’ Group. Sample sessions in Hip
Hop, Latin, Modern, & other dance styles are available, and begin next week..students
with any level of expertise, from beginners to expert, are welcome to join!
Princeton ‘Splash’ on Saturday, 4/20, is a free one-day event at which high school
students may take mini-classes on the Princeton campus –interested students should
register ASAP!
The First Tech Fund Fellowship Program is a college and career support program
for lower-income 10th and 11th graders is an excellent ongoing resource; they’ve
scheduled virtual information sessions for 4/16 and 4/23.
And for students with an interest in the field of law, the Manhattan District
Attorney in-person Career Panel on April 23rd is open to all interested students
COMMUNITY SERVICE: NYC SERVICE welcomes all students to help their
communities during April’s Youth Action Month – a wide variety of options are
available via the link to their website.
MUSEUMS/ART: The Guggenheim Museum’s Art Detectives summer program for
current 10th and 11th graders is accepting applications until April 14th.
STEM: The New York Historical Society in Manhattan offers several different free
short-term summer programs in Game Design, Web Design (for female students), and
Podcasting. Vaughn College near LaGuardia airport in Queens offers a number of
engineering, computer science, and tech programs this summer, with various
eligibility requirements and costs (including free options).
A free Game Design summer camp from the School of Interactive Arts in Manhattan
is now open to applications from current 8th, 9th, and 10th grade students.
The free two-day Spring Break Forensic Science Lab Workshops at John Jay
College in Manhattan are open for registration to students from all grades until April
15th.
And the Columbia Irving Cancer Center offers a free virtual introduction to
medical/research in this field, along with support resources for college admissions,
resumes, interviews, and public speaking.
SCHOLARSHIPS: Please note that the application deadline for the Stuvesant
Alumni Association scholarship program is April 15th!
